intro: Ornithogalum autumnale, commonly known as the autumn star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features a bulbous root system and produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers during the late summer to autumn months. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Due to its ornamental value and unique blooming period, it is often cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal.
